name: src/children.js
getChildrenProperty
description: returns a valid rjx.children property

unknown.tagValue: {Object[]|String} returns a valid rjx.children property that's either an array of RJX objects or a string

return.description: returns a valid rjx.children property that's either an array of RJX objects or a string

name: getChildrenProps
description: Used to pass properties down to child components if passprops is set to true

unknown.tagValue: {Object|String} returns a valid  Valid RJX Child object or a string

return.description: returns a valid  Valid RJX Child object or a string

name: getRJXChildren
description: returns React Child Elements via RJX

properties.name: this.componentLibraries
properties.description: react components to render with RJX

properties.name: this.boundedComponents
properties.description: list of components that require a bound this context (usefult for redux router)

name: src/components.js
componentMap
description: object of all react components available for RJX

name: getBoundedComponents
description: getBoundedComponents returns reactComponents with certain elements that have this bounded to select components in the boundedComponents list

unknown.tagValue: {Object} reactComponents object of all react components available for RJX

params.name: options.reactComponents
params.description: all react components available for RJX

params.name: boundedComponents
params.description: list of components to bind RJX this context (usually helpful for navigation and redux-router)

return.description: reactComponents object of all react components available for RJX

name: getComponentFromLibrary
description: returns a react component from a component library

unknown.tagValue: {function|undefined} react component from react library like bootstrap, material design or bulma

return.description: react component from react library like bootstrap, material design or bulma

name: getComponentFromMap
description: returns a react element from rjx.component

params.name: options.componentLibraries
params.description: react components to render from another component library like bootstrap or bulma

return.description: valid react element

name: getFunctionFromEval
description: Returns a new function from an options object

name: getReactClassComponent
description: Returns a new React Component

params.name: options.returnFactory
params.description: returns a React component if true otherwise returns Component Class

params.name: options.lazy
params.description: function that resolves {reactComponent,options} to lazy load component for code splitting

params.name: options.bindContext
params.description: bind class this reference to render function components

params.name: options.passstate
params.description: pass state as props to rendered component

params.name: reactComponent
params.description: an object of functions used for create-react-class

params.name: reactComponent.getDefaultProps.body
params.description: return an object for the default props

params.name: reactComponent.getInitialState.body
params.description: return an object for the default state

name: getReactFunctionComponent
description: Returns new React Function Component
todo: set 'functionprops' to set arguments for function

name: getReactContext
src/express.js
__express
description: Use RJX for express view rendering

params.name: options.__boundConfig
params.description: property used to bind this object for RJX, can be used to add custom components

name: src/main.js
rjxRender
description: Use RJX without any configuration to render RJX JSON to HTML and insert RJX into querySelector using ReactDOM.render
examples:
// Uses react to create

hello world

rjx.rjxRender({ rjx: { component: 'div', props:{className:'rjx-generated',children:[{ component:'p',props:{style:{color:'red'}}, children:'hello world' }]}}, querySelector:'#myApp', });

params.name: config
params.description: options used to inject html via ReactDOM.render

params.name: config.resources
params.description: any additional resource used for asynchronous properties

name: outputHTML
description: Use ReactDOMServer.renderToString to render html from RJX
examples:
// Uses react to create

hello world

rjx.outputHTML({ rjx: { component: 'div', props:{className:'rjx-generated',children:[{ component:'p',props:{style:{color:'red'}}, children:'hello world' }]}}, });

unknown.tagValue: {string} React genereated html via RJX JSON

params.name: config
params.description: options used to inject html via ReactDOM.render

params.name: config.resources
params.description: any additional resource used for asynchronous properties

return.description: React genereated html via RJX JSON

name: getReactElementFromRJX
description: Use React.createElement and RJX JSON to create React elements
examples:
// Uses react to create the equivalent JSX <myComponent style={{color:blue}}>hello world</myComponent>
rjx.getReactElementFromRJX({component:'myCompnent',props:{style:{color:'blue'}},children:'hello world'})

params.name: resources
params.description: any additional resource used for asynchronous properties

properties.name: this.componentLibraries
properties.description: react components to render with RJX

properties.name: this.returnJSON
properties.description: return json object of {type,props,children} instead of react element

properties.name: this.disableRenderIndexKey
properties.description: disables auto assign a key prop

properties.name: this.boundedComponents
properties.description: list of components that require a bound this context (usefult for redux router)

return.description: React element via React.createElement

name: getReactElementFromJSON
description: converts a json object {type,props,children} into a react element

return.description: React element via React.createElement

name: compile
description: converts a rjx json object into a react function component
examples: rjx.compile({rjx:{component:'div',props:{title:'some title attribute'},children:'inner html text'}}) //=>React Function Component

return.description: React element via React.createElement

name: outputJSX
description: converts RJX JSON IR to JSX
examples:
rjx.jsonToJSX({ type: 'div', props: { key: 5, title: 'test' }, children: 'hello' }) // => '
hello
'

return.description: jsx string

name: outputJSON
description: Compiles RJX into JSON IR format for react create element

params.name: resources
params.description: any additional resource used for asynchronous properties

return.description: json - {type,props,children}

name: jsonToJSX
description: converts RJX JSON IR to JSX
examples:
rjx.jsonToJSX({ type: 'div', props: { key: 5, title: 'test' }, children: 'hello' }) // => '
hello
'

return.description: jsx string

name: __getReact
description: Exposes react module used in RJX

return.description: React

name: __getReactDOM
description: Exposes react dom module used in RJX

return.description: ReactDOM

name: __getUseGlobalHook
description: Exposes global hook used in RJX

return.description: useGlobalHook

name: src/props.js
getParamNames
description: returns the names of parameters from a function declaration

name: getRJXProps
description: It uses traverse on a traverseObject to returns a resolved object on propName. So if you're making an ajax call and want to pass properties into a component, you can assign them using asyncprops and reference object properties by an array of property paths

params.name: traverseObject
params.description: the object that contains values of propName

params.name: options.propName
params.description: Property on RJX to resolve values onto, i.e (asyncprops,thisprops,windowprops)

return.description: resolved object

name: getChildrenComponents
description: returns children rjx components defined on __spreadComponent spread over an array on props.__spread

name: getEvalProps
description: Used to evalute javascript and set those variables as props. getEvalProps evaluates __dangerouslyEvalProps and __dangerouslyBindEvalProps properties with eval, this is used when component properties are functions, __dangerouslyBindEvalProps is used when those functions require that this is bound to the function. For __dangerouslyBindEvalProps it must resolve an expression, so functions should be wrapped in (). I.e. (function f(x){ return this.minimum+x;})

unknown.tagValue: {Object} returns resolved object with evaluated javascript

return.description: returns resolved object with evaluated javascript

name: getComponentProps
description: Resolves rjx.__dangerouslyInsertComponents into an object that turns each value into a React components. This is typically used in a library like Recharts where you pass custom components for chart ticks or plot points.

params.name: options.resources
params.description: object to use for resourceprops(asyncprops), usually a result of an asynchronous call

return.description: resolved object of React Components

name: getReactComponentProps
description: Resolves rjx.__dangerouslyInsertReactComponents into an object that turns each value into a React components. This is typically used in a library like Recharts where you pass custom components for chart ticks or plot points.

params.name: options.rjx
params.description:
Valid RJX JSON 
//  * @param {Object} [options.resources={}] - object to use for asyncprops, usually a result of an asynchronous call

return.description: resolved object of React Components

name: getFunctionFromProps
description: Takes a function string and returns a function on either this.props or window. The function can only be 2 levels deep

unknown.tagValue: {Function} returns a function from this.props or window functions

params.name: options.propFunc
params.description: function string, like func:window.LocalStorage.getItem or func:this.props.onClick  or func:inline.myInlineFunction

params.name: options.allProps
params.description: merged computed props, Object.assign({ key: renderIndex, }, thisprops, rjx.props, resourceprops, asyncprops, windowprops, evalProps, insertedComponents);

return.description: returns a function from this.props or window functions

name: getFunctionProps
description: Returns a resolved object from function strings that has functions pulled from rjx.__functionProps

unknown.tagValue: {Object} resolved object of functions from function strings

params.name: options.allProps
params.description: merged computed props, Object.assign({ key: renderIndex, }, thisprops, rjx.props, asyncprops, windowprops, evalProps, insertedComponents);

return.description: resolved object of functions from function strings

name: getWindowComponents
description: Returns a resolved object that has React Components pulled from window.__rjx_custom_elements

unknown.tagValue: {Object} resolved object of with React Components from a window property window.__rjx_custom_elements

params.name: options.allProps
params.description: merged computed props, Object.assign({ key: renderIndex, }, thisprops, rjx.props, asyncprops, windowprops, evalProps, insertedComponents);

return.description: resolved object of with React Components from a window property window.__rjx_custom_elements

name: getComputedProps
description: Returns computed properties for React Components and any property that's prefixed with __ is a computedProperty

params.name: options.resources
params.description: object to use for asyncprops, usually a result of an asynchronous call

params.name: options.renderIndex
params.description: number used for React key prop

params.name: options.componentLibraries
params.description: react components to render with RJX

params.name: options.ignoreReduxPropsInComponentLibraries
params.description: ignore redux props in this.props for component libraries, this is helpful incase these properties collide with component library element properties

name: src/utils.js
displayComponent
description: Used to evaluate whether or not to render a component

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} returns true if all comparisons are true or if using or comparisons, at least one condition is true

params.name: options.props
params.description: Props to test comparison values against, usually Object.assign(rjx.props,rjx.asyncprops,rjx.thisprops,rjx.windowprops)

return.description: returns true if all comparisons are true or if using or comparisons, at least one condition is true

name: getAdvancedBinding
description: Use to test if can bind components this context for react-redux-router

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} true if browser is not IE or old android / chrome

return.description: true if browser is not IE or old android / chrome

name: traverse
description: take an object of array paths to traverse and resolve

params.name: paths
params.description: an object to resolve array property paths

return.description: resolved object with traversed properties

name: validateRJX
description: Validates RJX JSON Syntax
examples:
validateRJX({component:'p',children:'hello world'})=>true
validateRJX({children:'hello world'})=>throw SyntaxError('[0001] Missing React Component')

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean|Error[]} either returns true if RJX is valid, or throws validation error or returns list of errors in array

params.name: returnAllErrors
params.description: flag to either throw error or to return all errors in an array of errors

return.description: either returns true if RJX is valid, or throws validation error or returns list of errors in array

name: validSimpleRJXSyntax
description: validates simple RJX Syntax {[component]:{props,children}}

return.description: returns true if simpleRJX is valid

name: simpleRJXSyntax
description: Transforms SimpleRJX to Valid RJX JSON {[component]:{props,children}} => {component,props,children}

return.description: returns a valid RJX JSON Object from a simple RJX JSON Object

name: getSimplifiedRJX
description: Transforms Valid RJX JSON to SimpleRJX  {component,props,children} => {[component]:{props,children}}

return.description: returns a simple RJX JSON Object from a valid RJX JSON Object

name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "rjx",
  "version": "3.0.3",
  "description": "React JSON Syntax - Construct React elements, JSX and HTML with JSON without transpilers. RJX support React Function and Class Components, React Lazy and Suspense Content, and full support for React Hooks",
  "main": "dist/rjx.cjs.js",
  "module": "dist/rjx.esm.js",
  "browser": "dist/rjx.umd.js",
  "web": "dist/rjx.web.js",
  "modules.root": "lib",
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "rollup -c -w",
    "test_simple": "node test/test.js",
    "test": "nyc  mocha \"test/**/*.{js,mjs}\" --include-all-sources -r esm ",
    "doc": "esdoc",
    "build": "rollup -c && esdoc",
    "benchmark": "node -r esm  benchmark/main_bmrk.js",
    "coverage": "nyc report --reporter=text-lcov | coveralls"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/repetere/rjx.git"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "jsx",
    "React",
    "server-side-react",
    "json jsx",
    "jamstack",
    "json",
    "rjx",
    "reactive",
    "react-json",
    "react-json-schema",
    "json-react",
    "jsx-json"
  ],
  "author": {
    "name": "Yaw Joseph Etse",
    "email": "yaw@repetere.io"
  },
  "license": "MIT",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/repetere/rjx/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/repetere/rjx#readme",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "^7.4.3",
    "@babel/plugin-external-helpers": "^7.2.0",
    "@babel/plugin-proposal-class-properties": "^7.4.0",
    "@babel/plugin-proposal-export-default-from": "^7.2.0",
    "@babel/plugin-proposal-export-namespace-from": "^7.2.0",
    "@babel/plugin-syntax-dynamic-import": "^7.2.0",
    "@babel/plugin-transform-runtime": "^7.4.3",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.4.3",
    "@babel/preset-react": "^7.0.0",
    "@babel/runtime": "^7.4.3",
    "@react-spectre/components": "^1.0.0-16",
    "@react-spectre/elements": "^1.0.0-16",
    "@react-spectre/layout": "^1.0.0-16",
    "@repetere/esdoc-inject-gtm-plugin": "^0.1.0",
    "babel-plugin-replace-imports": "^1.0.2",
    "benchmark": "^2.1.4",
    "bootstrap": "^4.3.1",
    "bulma": "^0.7.4",
    "chai": "^4.1.2",
    "chai-as-promised": "^7.1.1",
    "coveralls": "^3.0.3",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-inject-script-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-publish-markdown-plugin": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esm": "^3.2.22",
    "install": "^0.12.2",
    "jsdom": "^14.0.0",
    "jsdom-global": "^3.0.2",
    "lodash-es": "^4.17.11",
    "materialize-css": "^1.0.0",
    "microtime": "^3.0.0",
    "mini.css": "^3.0.1",
    "mocha": "^6.1.3",
    "mocha-sinon": "^2.1.0",
    "npm": "^6.9.0",
    "nyc": "^14.0.0",
    "react-bootstrap": "^1.0.0-beta.6",
    "react-materialize": "^3.0.3",
    "react-md": "^1.9.3",
    "react-spectre": "0.0.1-alpha.0",
    "rollup": "^1.10.0",
    "rollup-plugin-alias": "^1.5.1",
    "rollup-plugin-async": "^1.2.0",
    "rollup-plugin-babel": "^4.3.2",
    "rollup-plugin-commonjs": "^9.3.4",
    "rollup-plugin-node-builtins": "^2.1.2",
    "rollup-plugin-node-globals": "^1.2.1",
    "rollup-plugin-node-resolve": "^4.2.3",
    "rollup-plugin-replace": "^2.1.1",
    "rollup-plugin-terser": "^4.0.4",
    "rollup-plugin-terser-js": "^1.0.2",
    "routes": "^2.1.0",
    "semantic-ui-react": "^0.86.0",
    "sinon": "^7.3.2",
    "sinon-chai": "^3.2.0",
    "spectre.css": "^0.5.8",
    "use-global-hook": "^0.1.7"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "create-react-class": "^15.6.3",
    "react": "^16.8.6",
    "react-dom": "^16.8.6",
    "react-dom-factories": "^1.0.2",
    "ua-parser-js": "^0.7.19"
  }
}
name: package.json
./README.md
./manual/overview.md
./manual/usage.md
content:
# Frequently Asked Questions

## Scaling

- **How do I scale and descale my inputs?**
  - The library is only for model create, data engineering and modeling is typically handled elsewhere
  - Check out the regression examples (hint: use [ModelScript](https://repetere.github.io/modelscript/)).
- **How do I cross validate, test/train split, K-fold, etc?**
  - (See above) The library is only for model create, data engineering and modeling is typically handled elsewhere
  - Check out the code examples (hint: use [ModelScript](https://repetere.github.io/modelscript/)).

name: ./manual/faq.md
content:
# Frequently Asked Questions

## Scaling

- **How do I scale and descale my inputs?**
  - The library is only for model create, data engineering and modeling is typically handled elsewhere
  - Check out the regression examples (hint: use [ModelScript](https://repetere.github.io/modelscript/)).
- **How do I cross validate, test/train split, K-fold, etc?**
  - (See above) The library is only for model create, data engineering and modeling is typically handled elsewhere
  - Check out the code examples (hint: use [ModelScript](https://repetere.github.io/modelscript/)).

name: ./CHANGELOG.md
content:
# Changelog

## 3.0.0 (2019-04-20)

- **Chore**
  - Update Documentation

## 2.6.0 (2019-04-19)

- **Feat**
  - Added new compilation options rjx.compile, rjx.outputJSON, rjx.outputHTML, rjx.outputJSX
- **Fix**
  - pass functions in rjx object values
- **Chore**
  - added new benchmark tests

## 2.2.0 (2019-04-01)

- **Feat**
  - Added React.lazy support
  - Added React.Suspense support
- **Fix**
  - Named class support via options
  - passing state and props to class render component via options
- **Chore**
  
## 2.1.0 (2019-04-01)

- **Feat**
- **Fix**
  - Improved inline function support
  - Improved debugging support
  - Automated parameter detection
- **Chore**
  - Update Documentation

## 2.0.0 (2019-03-29)

- **Feat**
  - Added support for Function Components
  - Added support for Hooks
- **Fix**
  - Supports refs on __functionProps
- **Chore**
  - Update Documentation
